text: Receptionist Zuhara is very nice lady and knowledgeable. It's amazing how I can seek her advice before visiting the clinic - superb! Not recommend to go if it's a Locum doctor - it's not that bad but not something I favourite about it as i prefer the clinic doctor itself.

GP commented that I am too young to do a colonscopy, despite blood in my stools. Had I taken his advice I would have died. Turned out to be a stage 3 colon cancer. Don't just quote the general health advice of 50 years old! Greenhorn. 2 Nurses at reception said they will help to organise my referral to a colonscopy. They offered but didn't do it. Don't offer to do it, if you aren't do it. I was delayed by 2 weeks because of you receptionists! And i found out I had cancer. This is serious people!

The Doc is very informative, check patient pass record to provide more adequate and relavent treatment. He explains in details, discuss treatment plan with patient, and friendly. The staff nurses are very polite, friendly, show cares, explain medication in details and informative. Appreciate the service and help from them, thank you.

Doctors and clinic assistants are friendly and helpful. They are caring and polite to all the patients. Especially, the Malay clinic assistant (I donâ€™t know her name) she is extremely helpful and nice lady.

Nice and helpful doctor.
Received good advices from Dr Lye
Nurses are extremely helpful as well
